intro: Palicourea pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent yellow or orange corona. Palicourea pauciflora is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests.
